content: I've gone through all sorts of weird issues trying to get hubot set up and integrated with zulip. Now I have the hubot end sorted, but following the instructions here: https://talk.translightbulb.org/integrations/doc/hubot (npm install --save hubot-zulip) I get an error saying that package isn't available. Any alternative sources/updates for this?

The hubot-zulip package is still available. Can you copy and paste the exact error message rather than paraphrasing it?

However, Hubot upstream has been unmaintained for years, and it may not be possible to run it anymore.

Of course this is how it always works- I ran it for the fourth time and it worked. I fiddled with npm a little in between. Both hubot and the zulip are starting to show their age and decay. Getting it set up was putsy because hubot has a lot of quirks, but it does still work for me. Thanks for the help!
Lily Teske has marked this topic as resolved.

Lily Teske said:

Of course this is how it always works- I ran it for the fourth time and it worked. I fiddled with npm a little in between. Both hubot and the zulip are starting to show their age and decay. Getting it set up was putsy because hubot has a lot of quirks, but it does still work for me. Thanks for the help!

Zulip is actively develop compared to Hubot.
